title: Chicago exorcises ghosts of 1968 - Evanston Now
message:
Besides police behavior (which some 2024 protesters still criticized), a big difference between 1968 and 2024 was the mayor.
Delegate Alejandro Gallegos, from the small town of Crete, wore a kaffiyeh, which has become a symbol of Palestinian rights.
Delegate Alejandro Gallegos at Illinois DNC delegate breakfast.
Chicago police estimates were around 3,500 to 4,000 on Monday, and 3,000 on Thursday, in the two largest demonstrations.
But as Rep. Jan Schakowsky (D-Evanston) said, “all in all, I think this will be viewed as a very successful event here in Chicago.”
